bounce.logic
Class Physics

java.lang.Object
  bounce.logic.Physics

public class Physics
extends java.lang.Object

Provides methods and constants for performing calculations with standard physics formulas.

          The direction in which an object is moving along a vertical axis.

Constructor Detail

Physics

Method Detail

calcDisplacement

public static double calcDisplacement(Physics.Direction direction,
                                      double time,
                                      double velocity)
Calculates the total displacement that an object should have moved based on the specified time and velocity. The value is returned in meters rounded to the nearest millimeter (3 decimal places). The value is calculated using the formula:

d = vi2t + ½ at2

where:

d = displacement in meters
vi = the initial velocity
a = acceleration (in this case, Earth's average gravity: 9.8 m/s2)
t = time in seconds

Parameters:
direction - the direction in which the object is travelling
time - the time in seconds
velocity - the initial velocity
Returns:
the displacement of the object in meters

calcVelocity

public static double calcVelocity(double height)
Calculates the velocity of an object that has fallen from a specified height. The value is returned in meters per second rounded to the nearest millimeter (3 decimal places). The value is calculated using the formula:

v = √(2ad)

where:

v = velocity in meters per second
a = acceleration (in this case, Earth's average gravity: 9.8 m/s2)
d = the distance the object has travelled (in this case, the distance fallen)

Parameters:
height - the height in meters
Returns:
the velocity of the object in meters per second

calcBounceApex

public static double calcBounceApex(double velocity)
Calculates the maximum height of a bounce using acceleration, and initial and final velocities. The value is returned in meters rounded to the nearest millimeter (3 decimal places). The value is calculated using the formula:

±d = (vf2 - vi2) / 2g

where:

d = the distance in meters
vf = the final velocity in meters per second
vi = the initial velocity in meters per second
g = Earth's average gravity (9.8 m/s2)

Parameters:
velocity - the initial velocity in meters per second
Returns:
the distance in meters

calcTimeToApex

public static double calcTimeToApex(double displacement,
                                    double velocity)
Calculates the time in seconds needed for an object to reach an apex of a specified height. The value is returned in seconds rounded to the nearest millisecond (3 decimal places). The value is calculated using the formula:

t = d / vavg

where:

t = the time in seconds
d = the distance in meters
vavg = the average velocity travelled

Parameters:
displacement - the height of the apex in meters
velocity - the initial velocity of the object in meters per second
Returns:
the time in seconds
